campaign.story:
The coolest game to ever hit the planet first appeared some 38 years ago, featuring an electronic tower that lit up, played music, and somehow ran an epic fantasy adventure game with its state-of-the-art technological wizardry. That game was Dark Tower. We want to bring you that same sense of awe and wonder, pushing the boundaries of what a board game can actually do. After 3 years of painstaking work by a team of two dozen designers, engineers, and artists, we are thrilled to present to you a game with echoes of that long-gone wonder but ultimately unlike any game you've ever experienced.
Return to Dark Tower is a game for 1 to 4 heroes who undertake epic quests, fight fearsome foes, and test their mettle against the looming darkness of the titular tower. Now featuring both cooperative and competitive play. Designed by Rob Daviau and Isaac Childres -- designers of the two highest rated games of all time on Board Game Geek -- along with Noah Cohen, Brian Neff, and Justin D. Jacobson, the streamlined rules offer players difficult choices about when to advance their objective, gather resources, deal with threats, or level up.
Each player controls a unique hero with their own starting inventory and special abilities. Along the way you gain helpful items, powerful virtues, and trusty companions to help you achieve your goal: Find a way into the Tower and defeat a powerful adversary.
Figuring out the best way to utilize all of these assets is the key to victory. The game actively works to stop you, responding to your decisions and taking advantage of your missteps. Foes, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, will stalk your hero and assault your buildings.
Our innovative combat system leverages the power of the processor. Within the app, select virtual "cards" from each foe's unique deck, revealing the potential consequences of the fight. Then, use your hero's advantages to modify those results. Will you mitigate losses across the board, or focus on one to gain valuable resources for your effort.
Looming over the board, the Tower itself is the greatest menace you'll face. Each turn, you drop a skull in, representing the threat of corruption. You decide where emerging skulls are placed, making those buildings less useful. At times the Tower itself springs to life, releasing trapped skulls in a single wave or revealing glyphs that sap your will.
The path to victory is fraught with peril. Battles and events can give your hero corruption. If you don't cleanse skulls from the buildings to keep them in check, the supply quickly dwindles.  
Tarry too long and face the risk of having all of the seals of the Tower break. Corruption, skulls, and time: Any one of these pitfalls can spell defeat.
Return to Dark Tower constantly presents new challenges. The adversary within the tower, the plan to access the tower, and the suite of foes you will face can mix and match in thousands of combinations. Play the same array over again or try something completely new.
For complete information on how to play, you can download the draft rulebook: 
Or check out this live playthrough we'll be doing on the Dice Tower:
We've also arranged for a how-to-play video by Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! at the time of release. 
Created by a world-class team of designers and engineers led by Tim Burrell-Saward, an expert in technology-augmented games, the Tower itself is a game component without equal. From its very foundation, it's been devised to play an integral role in the game. Using a collection of magical-yet-reliable technologies, it generates game moments that simply wouldn't be possible without it. The Tower literally and figuratively dominates the table, drawing upon all of these powers to foil you. You will grow to curse its name.
Learn more about the intense tower development and prototyping process in Tim's designer diary.
The game itself is rich and satisfying. But we have a few additional items in this campaign to upgrade your play experience even further.
For those of you new to Kickstarter, an "add-on" is something that's not included with a regular pledge. If you're interested in getting the neoprene board or any other add-on we might add to the campaign, it's really simple. You have two options:
You can manually add the amount of the add-on to your existing pledge. (For the mat, it's $45 including shipping.) If you have already backed and you go to the top of the campaign page, you'll see a button in the top right that says "Manage your pledge". Click on it and it will take to you a "Change your pledge". Then you can click on the "Change your pledge" button. Then, in the box with your "Pledge amount" you can manually add the cost of the add-on to your pledge. Click "Continue" and your good to go. (NOTE: You can also use this method if you want to upgrade from the Charge the Tower to the Azkol's Fortune level.)
You can add any add-ons in BackerKit (our pledge manager) after the Kickstarter campaign is over. I'll talk more about how pledge managers work as we get closer to the end of the campaign, but it might help to think of it as an online store where you "spend" the money you pledged in the Kickstarter campaign and where you can add new items too, like the neoprene board.
The Alliances expansion offers new rules and components to add further depth and variety to the game. It includes two new heroes, who can be used in any game. The Archwright fortifies buildings to protect the kingdoms; the Haunted Recluse dabbles in forbidden lore to powerful effect. Influence is a new resource that can be used to form alliances with powerful guilds or to thwart the capricious whims of the nobles. It also features new treasures and allies with more intricate abilities for experienced gamers.
The Dark Horde box contains stunning sculpts by Punga Miniatures of all the foes in the game. These figures bring the foes to life. (Keep checking back here as we unlock new foes and show off new sculpts.)
 The Coffers box replaces the cardboard resource tokens from the game and the Alliances expansion with top-quality, heat-transfer plastic tokens that have a great feel and durability.
 This 50mm diameter and 5mm thick metal coin signifies the active player. If you signed up for notification before the campaign launched, you will receive this for free if you back the kickstarter and get at least one copy of the game.
Seriously, folks. This mat is huge and heavy. It's about 80% larger area than the game board. This makes the spaces larger as well of course, which can be a boon if you're playing with the miniature foes from Dark Horde. A real specialty item for those who want to play an epic game on an epic stage.
 Check out this rendered example of a gold foil art print:
Give all your cards a little extra protection. This add on includes enough high-quality sleeves to cover the cards in Return to Dark Tower and the Alliances expansion. 110 standard card sleeves and 85 mini sleeves (plus some extras for lost or broken sleeves). Most sleeves will have a custom print, but some standard sized sleeves will be completely clear to accommodate the double-sided cards.



Part of the fun of Kickstarter is achieving new heights and unlocking those sweet stretch goals. We've already packed a ton of content into the game, but we'll manage to find a way to get even more goodies in there. So let's break those seals!

At PAX Unplugged, we were able to run a number of tabletop media folks through the game. These opinions were freely given and provided without compensation. Here's what they had to say:
We know you'll love Return to Dark Tower. But you might be wondering why you should back now. There are four main reasons:
 You can get what you want. The game itself is not exclusive to Kickstarter. We do have a retailer pledge in the campaign, so there are stores who will have the game when it fulfills. However, we are still unsure if we will be able to sell the game into retail distribution, and the add-ons are particularly unlikely to be available widely if at all. Backing is the one way to make sure you get what you want.
 You'll get the game early. Even if the game does ultimately go into retail distribution, we promise to hold the retail street date for at least 90 days after fulfillment is completed. As a thank you for backing, we want to make sure our backers get the first chance to play.
 You'll get the game cheaper. As you can see above, you will pledge less than the suggested retail price. While it is true that some online retailers often sell games for below the regular price, that's less likely in this case. If the game ends up not going into retail distribution, aggressive discount merchants won't have access to it. Even if it does, the discount is likely not be much better than what we're offering in the campaign.
 You get to be a backer. Being a backer means being part of a community. You'll get to speak up on decisions we make during the campaign and share ideas with other backers. Most importantly, you'll help make this game become a reality. Some publishers have taken to using Kickstarter as a pre-order system. That is very much not the case with Return to Dark Tower. We simply could not make the game without the success of this campaign. You'll be a part of that success and part of unlocking stretch goals to make the game even better.
If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easier than it looks, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun! You can download this PDF file to learn the ins-and-outs of being a backer:

We are once again using Quartermaster Logistics to oversee the fulfillment process. They have an extremely efficient system, quality packaging, tracking information, and their customer service is second to none. We have key fulfillment partners within each shipping region and will freight the games directly to them, so there will be no surprise charges, such as customs fees or VAT, to the US, EU, Canada, Australia, and China.
Please use the chart below to calculate your shipping fees. Due to an error in setting up the Kickstarter page, some countries are charged at the time of pledge, while others will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign. You will also be charged additional shipping if you order add-ons or multiple copies and at similar rates.


We cannot ship to PO Boxes or to the following countries: Afghanistan, Burma (Myanmar), Cuba, Iran, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Russia, Sudan, Syria, and Ukraine.
We are also thrilled to be using BackerKit again. They are a "pledge manager", a third-party service that lets us manage our orders and fulfillment. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll be able to add items to your pledge at that time. If you are unsure about what items you want to get during the Kickstarter campaign, you can back at the "Map to BackerKit" level. This will qualify you as a backer for any backer-related goodies and will give you access to the pledge manager to fill out your order later.
RETAILERS
We have a special pledge tier for verified brick-and-mortar stores: For Bazaar Proprietors Only. You pledge only $50 during the campaign. In the pledge manager, you will finalize your order. However, you will not have to pay the remaining balance due until the games are ready to ship. Please click here for detailed information and terms.

Restoration Games was founded in 2016 by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory,  bringing the fun we had to a new generation of gamers.
SPREAD THE WORD
A Kickstarter campaign is only as strong as its backers. You will help push this project to be the best it can be. We greatly appreciate anything you can do to let people know about this campaign, whether it's posting to your social media accounts, sending emails to your friends, or letting a co-worker know about us.
If you haven't joined the game's facebook group, go do it. We've got a great group of fans, talking about the game, and it's a good place to go to ask questions.
Another fun way to spread the word is adopting a social media avatar. Tag yourself:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our third Kickstarter, and they just keep getting bigger. So, while we've learned from each one we've done, the challenges keep getting bigger as well. Notably, the tower itself is a complicated component with mechanical and electrical components. Fortunately, we've enlisted Tim Burrell-Saward and Andrew Sung, both with significant experience on these types of projects, to assist us in overseeing the manufacturing process. We've also built additional time into the delivery date to give us a buffer to deal with any potential issues that might arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Titanic Update: Revised Fulfillment Timeline and a Bunch of Other Stuff
updates.update_content:
Lots and lots of stuff to talk about. Everything is picking up the pace as we finalize manufacturing. To keep this update from getting too long, I'm going to update you all on the fulfillment timeline and then do some quick hits about a number of other things. Let's get to it!
Fulfillment Timeline

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: An APP-etizer with Tim Burrell-Saward (and Live Playthrough Next Week!)
updates.update_content: One critical part of the game we haven't shown much of is the companion app. In fact, our app developer, Porcelain Fortress, headed by the inimitable Björn Elíeser Jónsson, has been working non-stop for more than two years on it. And we're finally ready for you all to have an early look. I tapped Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer, to do a deep dive on the app's heroic journey to date. As with all of these updates, keep in mind that we are still refining and will continue to refine until the game gets into your hands and beyond. Everything here is still "in progress". Specifically, a lot of the text has not even had an editing pass. Let me make this extra-clear:

updates.update_userinfo: Final Engineering Prototype and Detailed Plastic Photos
updates.update_content:
As some of you might have seen, the team received a slew of FEPs this past week. "FEP" stands for "final engineering prototype". Sometimes also referred to as a "mass-production copy", it's the first full "game" comprising all of the final files intended to be used for mass production. It's one last check to find any last little problem before we hit the big red button that says: spend a million dollars and make 25,000 copies of this game.
I have to say, it's an extremely rewarding milestone. This is a project that I've been working on for three years. To open a box and see an actual playable game, is pretty amazing. But it's also a bit tense. It's a major checkpoint, where you're likely to run into issues that need addressing. You're just hoping that they're all manageable.

updates.update_userinfo: Call for Playtesters and a Look at the Hero Minis
updates.update_content:
We continue to make steady progress in the production process. All of the print materials have been locked down. Plastic production by Panda is underway. I've got a sweet photo of those hero minis for you in a minute.
But first, I'm putting out a call for playtesters. With the print materials locked down, we're looking to refine the data in the app to further balance the game and make it more fun. These playtests will be done in Tabletop Simulator (on Steam) and (unlike prior playtests) will use the actual app (with a built-in Tower simulator). We know some of you signed up for and did some playtesting for us last year. But circumstances can change -- especially during current events these days. So, even if you signed up before, if you're still interested in testing, please sign up again. To playtest, you will need access to Tabletop Simulator and an Android or iOS device to run the app. You would be able to playtest remotely, but it would be easier if you have a group that can get together in person to share the app device.

updates.update_userinfo: * IMPORTANT: Mobile Devices Survey - PLEASE FILL OUT *
updates.update_content: Listen, some updates are less exciting than others. Although I don't have anything sexy to show off, this is a very important update. The app infrastructure is nearly built. We'll then be moving into testing (and data editing). It would be extremely helpful to know what devices you all are planning on using to play the final game. This will help us make sure that the final version of the app is thoroughly tested for those devices. We'll have a deep dive update on the app with lots of gorgeous screen shots, but in the mean time, please go to this link, preferably with your device in hand, and complete this very brief, 4-question survey: MOBILE DEVICES SURVEY LINK

As I've mentioned, I'm planning on doing more, shorter updates on a regular basis, punctuated by longer, more in-depth updates when something important happens. Today, I've got a quickie.
As you know, we are in the very final stages of the Tower engineering before we sign off and manufacturing begins. Even then, they'll need to test the Towers to make sure they're working. That's easy for the other components: are the cards printed correctly, do the minis look good, etc. But how do you test an electronic Tower?

In this update, I'm going to show off the insert for the game (with a good look at the current state of the box as well). Basically, an unboxing in jpgs instead of video. It's a lot like an onion: multiple layers, and it'll make you cry (cause it's so beautiful). At the end of the update, I'll bring everyone up to speed on the general state of the project and where we are with various other parts of the game. So, if inserts don't tickle your toes, you can jump straight to the end.
Before we get into it, the usual caveats: This is 99% final, but that means it's 1% not final, which basically means things can still change. Not likely but possible. This goes doubly for the box render and the stuff rendered in the insert, like the punchboard and rules and such. Without further ado, let's start at the top.

updates.update_userinfo: A Closer Look at the Competitive Game
updates.update_content: For this update, I'll be showing off a bit more of the competitive game. As most of you know, the original game from 1982 was a competitive game. Players raced to defeat the brigands in the Tower. The first one to do it won the game. Early on in our development, we decided to make our restored version cooperative. We think it's more thematic appropriately and mechanically. But we knew some folks would like to be able to play competitively like in the original. We continued to work on it even as we entered the Kickstarter and finally announced we were doing it way back in Update #11.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Check Out the Box Bottom
updates.update_content:
As we move into this next stage of production, my plan is to post smaller, more regular updates and start showing off some stuff you all haven't seen or that has been updated since the campaign. Today, we're going to take a quick look at the box bottom.
First thing to mention is that it's not really the box bottom at all. The box will, of course, have a bottom, but this ain't it. Bigger picture, we know that you all have paid a lot of money to get this game. Granted, most of the expense is in that beautiful electronic Tower that will sit in the middle of the table. But we want to make sure the rest of the game meets that high bar. Traditionally, a box bottom serves as a marketing piece to attract the eye of someone browsing at the store, and it also has a number of legal requirements, like safety icons and copyright notices. Fine and necessary, but not pretty to look at. So we made the decision to have the traditional box bottom turn into a separate slip sheet that is placed over the box bottom and held into place by the shrinkwrap. When you open the shrink, you can toss the sheet. This meets our needs for the store shelf, but allows you to have a beautiful game box on your shelf at home.

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: Checking in on the Tower with Tim Burrell-Saward
updates.update_content:
I know folks like to get a closer look at the manufacturing process, and there's no one better to fill us in than Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer.
Before we jump in, Board Game Geek's annual "Most Anticipated" list is underway. Nominations are open for games you're looking forward to this year. If you're willing and able, we'd appreciate your support for our nomination. All you have to do is click here and click the green thumb under the box cover. Thanks!

campaign.story:
PLAY

Please note that the Monuments shown in this video are work in progress renders!

Click here to download the Foundations of Rome rulebook! 
 “Foundations of Rome is an amazing design that I've had the pleasure of watching come into being over the last few years.  Emerson has once again taken simplicity and greatness and combined the two into an extremely entertaining tactical city building game.” - Tom Vasel (The Dice Tower)
"It's as elegant and fun as every other Emerson game has been. Everyone picked it up quickly and the competition was fierce! This one is going to hit the table often!" - Bebo (Be Bold Games)
“Foundations of Rome engages the puzzle side of my brain - I enjoy obsessing over the position of my buildings, deciding between boosting my economy or scoring points. This game gives you a lot of decisions to make and you can pull off some very satisfying surprises.” -  Ryan Schoon (Man Vs. Meeple) 
"I really enjoy city building games, but Foundations of Rome takes the cake!  It felt like we were all building our different sections of Rome." - Mike Hinson (Elf Creek Games)
 "Maybe my favorite game designed by Emerson Matsuuchi, the game is easy to learn and very strategic. The game felt like a classic game. Arcane Wonders has made the production top-notch so not only will every gamer want to own the game, but it will be a treasured game in the collection."  - Daryl Andrews (designer of Sagrada)
“A very accessible game with great table presence as players work to build up the city of Rome. Yet hidden in the backstreets is a level of strategy that will get the brain working.” - Mandi and Michael (To Die For Games / The Dice Tower)
More videos to come!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Arcane Wonders LLC has been producing tabletop games and distributing them worldwide for over a decade. With dozens of published titles under our belt, we know every step of what it takes to get this game onto your doorstep on time and in pristine condition. We are seasoned veterans of international logistics and have included time in our shipping estimates for potential delays and unforeseen circumstances.

Due to the size and EPIC nature of this game we do NOT plan on releasing this game or expansions to retail distribution. We may sell additional copies at game conventions or through our webstore (at a higher price than you can get here!)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The first car combat game, and still the best . . . Car Wars returns in a bigger, faster edition. The detailed 1/64 scale cars move, shoot, and catch fire the way you remember, with faster car creation and play. Once again you can rule the roads!
NOTE: All miniatures are pre-assembled at the factory and packed unpainted. Miniatures shown in the photos are prototypes. Miniatures painted by Ben Williams. 
Foreground: Warhawk, one of the six miniatures included in the Car Wars Sixth Edition core game. Miniatures painted by Ben Williams. Displayed on Car Wars Playmat #1. All work shown is in progress and not final.
North America, A.D. 2070. It's a new American frontier. The collapse of the U.S. government plunged the country back into the good old days -- days of wilderness lawlessness, banditry, regional dictators, and of the men and women who combat them. Modern-day knights and gunslingers are in demand; but the automobile has replaced the horse, and the machine-gun and recoilless rifle have made the sword and Winchester obsolete.
Welcome to 2070. It's a rough world, but it's the only one around . . . 
Car Wars is the game of autoduelling; futuristic vehicular combat where the right of way goes to the biggest guns. Players design their cars -- complete with weapons, accessories, and crew -- and then take them into the arena where one emerges victorious . . . and the others are annihilated.
First published in 1981, the earlier editions of Car Wars have sold over one million games and accessories during the game's near-four decades of life. Over the years, the Car Wars game -- as well as the world of Autoduel America -- has grown, adding more rules, expansions, and setting information. Car Wars has been featured in comic books, novels, solo adventure gamebooks, and even the fan-favorite classic Autoduel video game. 
Now, with your support, we're bringing Car Wars back as a faster, streamlined edition with detailed plastic models. The new Car Wars game was designed to put you in the driver's seat and into the action within moments of opening the game box.
After six years of design, development, playtesting, and constant refinement and improvement, we've completed the core of the new Car Wars Sixth Edition game and we're now ready for your support. 
The new core game includes:
24-page rulebook, covering everything from building your car to movement and combat. All of the rules you need to start playing the game within moments of opening the box! 
TEN (stretch goal unlocked!) 1/64 scale highly-detailed plastic car models. Pre-assembled at the factory, these miniatures are ready to paint and take into the arena. Or, for those of you who want to jump into the action quickly, use the minis unpainted; the included car bases are color-coded so that you can instantly tell which car is yours during the heat of battle. 
Four color-coded player dashboards. These thick, durable chipboard player boards include spaces for your car's external armor, tire points, power plant points, as well as your car's current speed.
Four car design decks, one for each of the included player colors. Using the Build Point and Crew Point mechanics, you can create a new car (and outfit your driver and gunner) in less than ten minutes! 
Two different internal damage card decks, one for low-point value games and one for high-point value games. Once armor is penetrated, a card is randomly drawn to determine which internal components are hit by an attack.
Twenty custom six-sided dice! These are used for all attack rolls, defensive rolls, and movement rolls in the game. 
A chipboard turning key. Use this when moving and maneuvering your car. The turning key works perfectly with the color-coded car bases; your car pivots over the turning key so that every swerve and turn made during the game is as accurate as possible. (Includes two copies of the key.)
Dozens of damage, control, Ace, and other types of tokens that are required to track the status of various parts of the game. 
A streamlined collision system that keeps the game flowing. See how the bases are used to push objects in a collision in this Facebook video. 
Play on any smooth tabletop . . . or upgrade your game with one of the Car Wars playmats (see Add-Ons, below). The basic arena is a 36" x 36" playspace; scenarios expand play to even larger spaces for those of you who want to play a highway game, fight in a big arena, or tackle a custom scenario of your own design.
Do you want to see Car Wars Sixth Edition in action? Check out these gameplay videos for an overview of the game's movement and combat systems in action. More videos to come between now and the close of the Kickstarter campaign on January 6, 2020!

After the Kickstarter project closes, and after all pledges are collected, we will open the BackerKit pledge manager. There you will provide your physical address, select any add-ons you may want, and pay for shipping. See the FAQ for estimated shipping costs. Failure to complete your BackerKit survey by the posted deadline (shared when the surveys are opened) will result in a refund and removal from the project.
We make every attempt not to incur any taxes or custom fees which could be passed along. However, should any fees be levied, they are exclusively your responsibility. These fees will be determined when the shipment arrives in your country. We also cannot guarantee that an order will not be confiscated or rejected by your country's customs.
If you wish, you may choose to use a fulfillment service. This allows you to pledge for the project and then provide us with a U.S. address for delivery of your rewards. Forwarding from the fulfillment service, as well as any local fees, is your responsibility when using a fulfillment company.
INTERNATIONAL DELIVERY NOTE: International backers will receive their rewards roughly three months (February 2021 estimated delivery) after U.S. backers.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough Kickstarter experience to deal with issues should they arise. 

Car Wars Sixth Edition is our largest project of 2020. This campaign is set to close on January 6, 2020, and -- if successful -- will lead to many months of work as our team completes the game and expansions and prepares everything for manufacturing.

We have completed a lot of the necessary work for the game already, but project stretch goals may greatly expand on the number of tasks we must finish before the game is ready for manufacturing. We're doing what we can to stay ahead of any stretch goals, but when it comes to creative efforts, there are times when some stages require more attention and refinement than we may first expect. We're doing all we can to deliver the project on schedule, but we also admit that there are sometimes issues that lead to delays.

As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with our backers during and after the Kickstarter, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
At the moment, we've approved many of the game and expansion packs. The assembly stage continues, but we can see a light at the end of the tunnel. We do not yet have a completion date, but we are getting very close. News to come.
For now, new pics that Sabrina shot today in the office!
- Phil Reed

Today, I'm visiting the GPI offices and reviewing the Car Wars project.  The game is still in the assembly stage, and we are now watching assembly videos from the factory.
While we continue spending the day going over Car Wars, here are a few quick pics I snapped. We should be able to share the assembly videos, probably next week.
- Phil Reed

As of today, the project is moving into the final stages of manufacturing and is expected to shift into the assembly stage ASAP. The factory continues to keep everything moving forward and we should have more news in a week or two. If all goes well, we'll also start to see the 100% completed production samples before the end of the month.
- Phil Reed

Everything is still in manufacturing and expected to move into assembly next month. We'll share when we have more news, but for now here's a video that was sent to us showing all of the final test shots* of the minis as the factory moves these into final manufacturing. Reportedly, lots of paper, chipboard, and cardboard have already been turning into Car Wars boxes, rules, etc. Things are racing along!
- Phil Reed

We've got some new pics from the factory this morning, this time showing how the three box sets in the core game look with many of their goodies. We're not yet at the finish line, but things are starting to come together as the factory works through manufacturing all of the necessary components.
- Phil Reed

Now that the new year is behind us and we're in the manufacturing stage, we have a little more info on when everything is expected to complete production. By mid-May, we should be in the assembly stage of the project. This is when all of the plastics, paper, chipboard, and cardstock components are complete and the factory puts together the finished games and expansions.
Between now and then, we'll receive very little in the way of new information.  During manufacturing, the factory (multiple factories, if we want to get technical) makes all of the stuff. If it were a normal year, I would join a few of our partners at GPI for a trip to the primary assembly factory for a look at everything. Unfortunately, this is not a normal year.

updates.update_userinfo: Multiple PDFs Released as BackerKit Digital Downloads
updates.update_content:
By now, you should have received email notification from BackerKit about new digital downloads. We've released PDFs of the rules for the Car Wars Sixth Edition game . . . as well as the rules/credit sheets associated with many of the expansions. 
Enjoy the PDFs! We look forward to the day when all of us can hold the printed rules -- and finished games and expansions! -- in our hands and get the completed game on the table.
NOTE: Your BackerKit account will only have those files associated with your rewards. If your rewards package does not include a specific title, then you will not have the PDF for that title. Please email help@sjgames.com if you have any questions.

updates.update_userinfo: Car Wars Sixth Edition Tooling Update. Good News!
updates.update_content:
Thanks to a last-minute push by the team at GPI, we completed the tooling stage before the factory closed down for Chinese New Year. There are a few minor issues, but nothing that we cannot address during the manufacturing process.

Once the factory opens, we'll officially shift the project into the production stage. There will still be a number of checks (photos and video, so we can confirm that those minor issues are handled). We will not skip steps during this process or sign off on "meh, that kinda works" components. We get one chance to do this right, and we are going to do what it takes to make the game (and all of the expansions) the best we can manage. This means that although we are moving into production, we may find an item or two that requires another round of tweaks during manufacturing.

We know the one question everyone is asking comes down to: When will I get my game? We cannot answer that question until the factory opens and together we can nail down a final production schedule. One of the biggest risks of a Kickstarter campaign -- especially one of this size -- is that everyone gets to see the behind-the-scenes delays and issues that can plague a project. We don't assign a release date for many of our games until everything is at print (and often not until we have the tooling complete). This makes it easier to hit release dates, but even that has been a major challenge over the last year as the global pandemic disrupts everything.

We'll be back with a new update in early March after the factory opens and we work out a tentative production timeline. Once we have a production schedule, then we can start to plan a shipping schedule, but even that will be subject to the issues that are delaying shipping containers. (As an example, we had a 40' container canceled by the freight company last month. That tore a giant hole in our plans and was completely outside of our control.)

As always, thank you for your patience and understanding as we continue to push hard at wrapping up the game, accessories, and expansions.

updates.update_userinfo: Vehicle Guide Sample Spreads, Tooling Update
updates.update_content:
As we wait for the factory, below are two sample page spreads from the Car Wars Vehicle Guide. This add-on item is loaded with page after page of pre-designed cars, giving you an even faster way to start playing the game just as soon as you've opened the boxes and assembled your tools. Each design tells you which cards are needed to build the car*; the designs use cards from across the entire range of expansions that are being produced thanks to your support of this campaign.
* And the book even notes which set has the miniature of the car.
Tooling Update

The two vac trays for the core game have arrived!
With the Steve Jackson Games and GPI winter break coming up fast (both companies are closed starting Thursday), there's a chance we won't see the next round of samples until the first week of January. We'll have more pics to share as move closer and closer to the tooling finish line and prepare to officially move into final production.
- Phil Reed

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Duck Sanctuary! 
Come enjoy the company of the ducks while visiting the different locations around the park.
In Ducks in Tow, you are walking around the park feeding the ducks their favourite food. When you feed them, they start following you and you must lead them to their favourite locations in the park.
When you successfully lead them to their favourite location, you take a photo with them and they waddle off to find their friends. Maybe you’ll see them again later as you continue your walk around the park.
You will be completing Location Cards that will gain you points at the end of the game. Once you have completed a few Location Cards, you might be able to claim a Formation Card, which will give you additional points at the end of the game.






Special thanks to the Playtesters who helped shape this game in a short period of time
Adrian Adamsecu, Andrei Filip, Azlen Elza, Benson Kwok, Brittany Cole, Chris Chung, Cindy Huang, Colin Kierans, Craig Bednar, Dan Kalf, Daryl Andrews, Eduardo Longo Aureliano Junior, Eric Lang, Eric Raue , Garrett Petersen, Greg Stoddard, Hoby Chou, Jason Begg, Jason Thompson, Jay Cormier, Jay Zhou, Jeremy Rozenhart, John Brieger, Jonathan Kinney, Joshua Norris, Kevin Lee, Lawson Lim, Les Cheung, Mandy Jelsma, Marcel Perro, Mark Ellis, Mark Yuasa, Mike Chang, Mike Peredo, Nathan Ngai, Nick Angiers, Nick Kitts, Pattie Shang, Pete Butler-Davis, Peter Lipson, Ross Drew, Simpson Siu, Tallahassee Bittencourt, Tammy Lyon, Tyson Gajewski, Vivian Riwa
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a relaunch of the 3rd project for First Fish Games. We made some minor changes to the campaign in order to make this campaign the best it can be. We will continue to be as transparent as possible as we want to build trust with our backers. We've done our best to provide our backers with a reasonable Kickstarter discount for both the game itself and the shipping costs. Everyone understands that there are always risks involved with Kickstarter campaigns but we will do our best to minimize those risks.

updates.update_content:
Hello friends!

We are nearing the full completion of deliveries soon as Aetherworks has received the AUS/NZ games and will be processing them shortly! Thank you guys so much for your patience through this long journey, we greatly appreciate it!

updates.update_userinfo: The Ducks have landed in Vancouver!
updates.update_content:
The shipment was finally released from customs, yay! 🦆
For those of you who selected LOCAL PICKUP, we will be sending games to Raincity Games (in International Village) today so you will be able to go get your game anytime starting tomorrow (October 31st).
For Canadian backers who selected delivery, we’ll be packaging games this weekend to be sent out Monday, so game should be arriving within the next 1-2 weeks depending where you are in Canada! 🇨🇦
My dear Australian friends, I will be sure to post an update once the games arrive at Aetherworks. Thank you for your patience 🙏

Hello friends,
Thank you so much for your patience!
Our Canadian shipment finally got released from its examination today so it should be offloading from the vessel this week. Won’t be too much longer for all my Canadian friends 🥰

Hello friends!
As everyone starts to receive their games, I've gotten a few concerns that the ducks are not fitting on the trays. This is entirely possible if the coating of paint happens to be just a tad too thick, but it could also be that they're not being snapped in properly because there's concern about the tray breaking. I've recorded a little video demonstration to hopefully help make it clear how the ducks are supposed to fit and that you shouldn't worry about pushing a little harder to make them snap in properly.

Hello friends!

Just a quick update for everyone on where shipments are at the moment.

UNITED STATES: As you probably have seen already, Quartermaster Logistics  has sent out email confirmations for you to finalize your address. Please make sure you confirm your address so that we can make sure your games are delivered to the right place. The US bound vessel should be arriving this week (if it hasn't already) but they haven't given me a firm date. It may take 1-2 weeks for Quartermaster to receive the shipment. I'm hoping we will start seeing deliveries start around mid October.

Hello!
First of all, let me apologies for the long silence. I have been waiting for vessel booking information and apparently the ports in China are crazy busy and bookings keep getting delayed. 
Here's our current vessel booking information but I've been warned that it can change due to the port delays. So hopefully we won't see too much of a delay, but I wanted to share with you this information as soon as I received it.

Hello duck lovers!
Great news! We finally have an updated estimate completion date from the manufacturer! They expect to be finished by July 30th. After that, the games will be sent to port to be shipped across the world to the main hubs where we will be fulfilling your orders from. It usually takes the vessels approximately 30 days to reach their destination. This means if everything goes smoothly, we should expect deliveries to start happening by early September.

Hello duck lovers!
A few people have asked for the solo rules, so we've added them to our website, and also I'll share the link here for your convenience!  Ducks in Tow - solo rules  We were also able to add a youth variant that allows you to play with younger children. These rules will be included in the rulebook!
Manufacturing in underway and looking to be about 1 months time to complete all the parts. This delay was to make sure everything fit nicely in the plastic insert (especially sleeved cards!), and also to make the drawstring bags sit open on the table the way we wanted it to. Thanks for your understanding and patience as we do our best to make this game top quality!

Hi friends! Hope you’re all staying safe. I’m just here to provide you with a small update on where we are.
Currently doing some minor changes to the most recent sample we received a few days ago. The only changes we are waiting for now are for the plastic insert and the drawstring bags. They are small changes that shouldn’t take too long and once we receive the new samples everything will be good to go.

campaign.story:
We believe the best communities are the ones that form around tabletop games. Whether it’s board games, roleplaying, cards, miniatures, or party games, bringing people together is what tabletop games do best.
You are invited to join Rick Rollz America as one of the Road Warriors, with host Rick Ankney on an epic road trip across America, visiting the incredible local game stores where communities gather, and talking with the amazing designers, artists, publishers and other creators who make the games we love. Together, Rick Rollz America will shine a spotlight on everything great about tabletop gaming and grow our communities by creating captivating videos that show what everyone else has been missing out on!
With Rick at the wheel, The ROAD WARRIORS will go behind the scenes with some of the biggest names in the tabletop industry and see how they’re bringing more games to more people. If we’re lucky (and Rick is famously lucky), we’ll even get some exclusive sneak previews of upcoming games!
Most importantly, the landmarks on our adventure are the pillars of every community: the FRIENDLY LOCAL GAME STORES! These bastions of games and gathering are where tons of communities are built, and this road trip will pay homage to the noble mission we share with them: to grow the ranks of tabletop gaming. The Road Warrior(s) will crash through the front doors and show off the space, staff, and selection of some of the greatest friendly local game stores across the country.
We would be honored to have your support as a member of Rick's Road Warriors on this epic road trip. We have some incredible loot for Road Warriors and Rally Point retailers to show they were one of the first to join us on this journey!
We are also very proud to be welcoming some fantastic companies that will be providing sponsorship in various forms over the course of Rick Rollz America. Here are some of those we have secured already!
PLEDGE LEVELS 
Tommy Rice - Author of THE LOK
As I roll across the USA we’ll be celebrating the best there is in gaming and geek culture! We see comic book characters like Superman, the Hulk, Thor… and we play games as Half-Giant Barbarians or Rogues that can leap over ANY wall with a crit! Well, why can’t we be those people ourselves? We can certainly try! So, as I roll to your city, I’m getting fit and who is helping me? One of our own gamers, my correspondent... the Iron Author… Tommy Rice!
Author of THE LOK, game designer for Mythic Games, bodybuilder, and former Pro-footballer,  Tommy is offering up some great things here to help our Road Warriors start their fitness journeys!
STRETCH GOALS
Who is your fearless Host?
You probably know Rick Ankney as the former host of innovative video series such as “Painting Happy Lil Minis”, “Board Games and Beyond”, and “Building Character.” Rick has been making tabletop content and spreading gaming for over 5 years, and was the Production Manager of Sapphire Studios: the home of Game Trade Media and Previews World Weekly for comics and games distribution companies.
HERE is a look at Painting Happy Lil Minis 
HERE is look at some Building Character episodes 
And HERE are a bunch of interviews from Origins Game Fair 2019: 
But did you know that Rick is a retired Navy Corpsman, was a bona-fide Roadie, and loves the open road? Rick Rollz America is an engaging project that combines his loves of tabletop, travelling, and talking to people who share his passions.
But he can’t do it alone! Together with your help, Rick will take the road less travelled (and many well-travelled roads, too) to personally visit the people who make the magic of tabletop gaming possible, and share it all with the world. Your support as a member of The Road Warriors means you’ll be there right beside him, fueling this year-long adventure of connecting communities across the country. 
The rubber hits the road on January 1st, 2020! Rick  will be out on the road through December, updating you all along the way via social media, so be sure to follow Rick Rollz America everywhere:
Facebook: www.facebook.com/rickrollzamerica
Twitter: @RickRollzAmerica
Instagram:  Rickrollzamerica
Twitch:@RickRollzAmerica
Youtube:Rick Rollz America
If you’ve made it this far, thanks a ton for learning about Rick Rollz America. If you’re a fan of tabletop games and value the communities that make this hobby so special, we would love your support. Even if you can’t pledge right now, sharing this campaign and our social media account links with your friends would mean the world to us.
Hopefully we’ll see you out there on the road and can get in some games together!
SHIPPING
Shipping will be collected in backerkit at the end of the campaign.  Shipping for most pledges (Minus Retailer Pledges)will be $10.00 or less in the USA depended on pledge level selected.

updates.update_content: Hey Everyone, just wanted to say I hope you are all staying safe and healthy during this odd time.  I am currently isolated at a red roof  Inn.  (not awesome)  since the quarantine started for me in March a lot of crazy has happened.  which has pushed the delivery date to the right for the pledges.  I am waiting for the coins ( which were made in china) the apparel company I am using shut down until this is over and I am waiting on the stickers. once they all start coming in I will be sending them out post haste.  I appreciate everyone's continued support, and patience and I hope to see you all once this is over and I can get back on the road.

Hey Everyone,
Hope all is well and you are making 2020 your Year to take the Initiative!  ( Ah D&D Humor) So things are rolling right along on the travel so far and things are starting to show up from the manufacturers.  Stickers and an additional special bit o'fun.  I am Dallas now and will be livestreaming tomorrow (Sat) from Madness Games and Comics in (Plano) then it is off to Little Rock for Goblin Games.  Hope you can all tune in and say hi!  Also if you get a chance go check out the Facebook page www.facebook.com/rickrollzamerica and check out some of the videos from all the places I have hit up already.  Especially the Hunter Pence interview.   Lots more to come and look forward to getting everything out to you as soon as it all is in hand.

Hi Everyone,
Hope you have all had a great week so far.   Got back from PAX unplugged which was amazing, and actually getting to see many of you there was awesome.  Now that the kickstarter is funded the next step is on to fulfillment and getting all the sweet swag made.  Now that we have good numbers to give to the manufacturers for the Swag the process is underway, I am really excited to get all these out to everyone and I look forward to seeing all you ROAD WARRIORS/RICK ROLLERS out on the well...ROAD.

updates.update_userinfo: Former 49er Tommy Rice has joined up to help me on this journey.
updates.update_content: SO as many of you may or may not know I have been trying ( and Minor successes) in loosing weight recently.  Well a new aspect of the Rick Rollz America  adventure the Iron Author Tommy Rice has joined up to help guide me on a 52 weeks to fitness so while I am out on the road and running around spotlighting our community and the Brick and Mortar stores that are the corner stone of these communities,  I will also be streaming my fitness adventures as well across the country ( And working in how this can be a part of the gaming/pop culture community for everyone.) My Goal is to lose 100lbs by the end of 2020.   SO In that 3 new Kickstarter Pledge levels have been added for these last 3 days of the kickstarter.   Enjoy this journey in all its forms and I look forward to 2020 and beyond.

updates.update_userinfo: FUNDED!! Thanks everyone!! Now lets get to the Stretch Goals....ASMR VIDEOS WOOT WOOT!
updates.update_content:
That's Right!! RIck Rollz America is Funded!  Thanks to all of you! I am truly humbled by the support from all of you in this project.  If you haven't seen it yet you will notice that the stretch goals take us into the Land of ASMR videos.  Which one has already unlocked so I will be making one featuring Atlas Games The White Box I look forward to making it and entertaining you all!
You are all the BEST!

updates.update_userinfo: I hope everyone had a wonderful Thanksgiving, Black Friday and Cyber Monday!
updates.update_content:
To everyone who has pledged and shown support to the kickstarter, you are all ROAD WARRIORS!  Thank you so much, we are at 62% with 5 more days to go.  I know we are going to make it!  I am really excited about everything going on with this project and where it is going to lead!  I did an unboxing video over at www.facebook.com/rickrollzamerica ( I picked up some audio/podcast gear on Black Friday) if wanna check it out. And then did a reboxing on my personal page.  
If you have the opportunity let your Local Game stores know about the kickstarter.

SWEEET we have achieved over 50% funded!  THANK YOU!!!  We are trucking along towards that goal!   Speaking of Trucking along here is what the road looks like for FEB 2020.

I hope everyone had a wonderful Thanksgiving today!  I would like to let you all know that I am thankful for your support in this project!  We have cracked 50% and now onto the full goal!  For those of you going to participate in the Black Friday sales good luck and be safe.

support.title: GET GEEKY WITH GAMER LEAF
support.descp: Ever want to be on the radio? Now's your chance! You and a friend of your choosing join me on an episode of Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf to talk about whatever y'all'd like to. Limit 30 minute chat that goes on the show within 1 week of recording.

support.title: Adventures in Application Acquisition
support.descp:
You will get a whole segment dedicated to our preview of your application and/or video game that you'd like us to review in this segment of our regular show.
Want us to include a video as well going out to our 800+ YouTube Subscribers as well as our over 1,000+ FB Followers? For an additional $75 we will throw a video option onto your reward.

support.title: Publisher's Potted Plant
support.descp:
We will shout out your company and/or product for every podcast episode for 1 month. Want it shouted out for more than 1 month of episodes? No problem! Pledge for that amount and send me a message letting us know how many months you'd like us to do that for. Note: We release at least 3 episodes per week. Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.
Plus, We will also create a small 5 minute commercial episode to air all by it's lonesome that we create with your collaboration that we will air 2 weeks before or after the ad campaign.

support.title: PUBLISHER'S CACTUS
support.descp:
In addition to what you're already getting in the Publisher's Potted Plant you will also get:
We will be devoting a whole podcast episode to YOU our sponsor.
In which we will Talk about/review the games in your catalog.
The episode will be themed around you the publisher. We will do all the work in preparing your specially tailored episode. If you'd like to provide input that is completely okay. But, I know you're busy. (Hey, that's what you're pledging for us to do)
No other sponsor's or anything will appear on this episode.
Want us to include a video as well going out to our 800+ YouTube Subscribers as well as our over 1,000+ FB Followers? For an additional $75 we will throw a video option onto your reward.

support.title: Publisher's Plant
support.descp:
A bit about the show stats:
Each episode typically gets between 500-1,550 listens during the 1st 30 days. Trending up from there. Plus on FB we're getting a 2,500-10,000+ reach per post
A month of my podcasting services (worth almost $400) by backing us on Kickstarter we'll give these all to you ( Kickstarter Corner, Episode Sponsorship spots, Interview before Kickstarter Corner and a super Secret e-mail episode going out to my almost 1500 e-mail subscribers) for only $225.
Plus we'll have you on the show before you launch your campaign and at the last of your campaign as well. The general population of publishers only comes on one episode per campaign at a rate of $35-$60.Not something offered to the general public.
Can be used anytime within the calendar year

support.title: Publisher's Tree
support.descp: A years worth of Sponsorship spots. We release at least 3 episodes per week. 3 choices to choose from: 1 episode per week @$250, 2 episodes per week @$500 & 3 episodes per week at $600(Limited to 3 of each). If you choose to sponsor more than one episode per week just pledge the extra cost here and send me a message here on Kickstarter.

support.title: Novice
support.descp:
You'll get all the updates.
For everyone who backs at this level we'll make and dedicate our Leaf Lover's Page on our website to YOU the BACKERS on our website
Everyone of you will also get an individual shoutout on your own episode dedicated to you and your pledge! Thanks, we couldn't do this without you! (YES you read that right, everyone will have their own episode in which we SHOUT YOU OUT!)

support.title: Seasoned

Plus, Everyone at this level will be granted access to ONE EPISODE PER WEEK of Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf with out the sponsor ads and Kickstarter Corner, before the general public! (We release at least 3 episodes per week, if not more. On Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.)

support.title: Veteran
support.descp:

Plus, Everyone at this level will be granted access to EVERY EPISODE of Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf with out the sponsor ads and Kickstarter Corner, before the general public! (We release at least 3 episodes per week, if not more. On Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.)

Plus you'll be able to help us brainstorm on the new segments you'd like to hear on the show and other Geeky stuff in a Discord server Wizard Leaf will be creating for us .

With it you will receive an Honorary Producer Certificate autographed by Scott Almes, Roland McDonald and Michael Coe.
You will also be credited as Honorary Producer in the rulebook.
You will also receive a print-on-demand copy of Tiny Epic Mechs using the Premium Print 'N Play files in December 2018.
You may add extra copies of TEM to your order in PledgeManager that will be delivered with the rest of the project fulfillment in August 2019 (estimated ETA).

PREMIUM PRINT & PLAY
TINY EPIC MECHS - DELUXE GAME
HONORARY PRODUCER RULEBOOK CREDIT

updates.update_content:
Starcadians, report in!
We hope you're all safe, healthy, and enjoying Starcadia Quest! 
It has been a few months since shipment was completed and the battle between the crews and against Thorne and his army started. By now, you should have had the opportunity to play the different quests, with your great variety of Heroes, and face the diverse Enemies. With all of the content sinking in, it's a perfect time for a live Q&A!

updates.update_userinfo: Starcadia Quest on CMON Comics - Vol. 1!
updates.update_content:
Starcadians, report in!
We hope you're all healthy and well!
At the beginning of the month we confirmed that all pledges were already shipped and we're very pleased to be receiving great feedback on the game!
If you're enjoying your Starcadia Quest adventures, today we come to you with more exciting news!
Starcadia Quest - Heart of a Star

Starcadians, report in!
We have received confirmation that the situation with the Poland pallet addressed on the previous update (update# 71) has been resolved and by now all hubs have shipped all pledges. Backers should have received their pledges, or at least a tracking number indicating that the pledge is on its way to you. Late Confirms are also being shipped out by the US hub. If you are still waiting on your pledge/tracking, please contact our Support Team at https://support.cmon.com/hc/en-us if you have not already done so.

updates.update_userinfo: EU Shipment Update, FAQ & Masmorra Heroes
updates.update_content:
Starcadians, report in!
We hope that everyone's been coping well, staying home and keeping healthy! In our last update, we identified an issue with deliveries in the EU highlighted to us by some backers. Since then, the hub has been investigating this issue with their couriers to determine the extent of the impact. It was reported back to us that the issue has been identified and seems to be limited to a consolidated pallet scheduled for Poland. This pallet is unfortunately considered to be lost in transit.

Starcadians, report in!
In our previous update, we stated that shipments were completed by the hubs. Although the information is accurate as hubs have shipped everything, reporting as complete, it does not take into account whether or not the packages have reached their destinations. 
We have been informed that European countries implemented regulations to limit, or even halt, shipping processes, and that unfortunately that is impacting the delivery of some of your pledges. Since the EU hub shipped the packages to the affected countries before such measures were implemented, these packages were already in transit (for example, delivery to destination country from the hub, or from customs to delivery partners for last mile fulfillment).

updates.update_userinfo: Final Delivery Update, Post Delivery Support & Extras Unboxing!
updates.update_content:
Starcadians, report in!
First off, we sincerely hope that everyone is safe and well, with all the changes that your respective governments have implemented to help combat this pandemic. It is a very unfortunate circumstance globally, and we can only hope that we will overcome this in the time to come. In the meantime, for backers who have received their pledges, we hope that you've been utilizing your time at home well by playing a ton!

Starcadians, report in!
In just a span of two weeks, we've seen the rapid spread of the pandemic with countries locking down and limiting movement. It is unfortunately a very uncertain time we live in and we sincerely hope that you and your loved ones are safe and well.
Kudos to the hubs and their delivery partners and personnel, who are adapting to the situation, and making sure the gears keep grinding. We ask that you bear with us just a little more if you have not yet received your pledges yet, as everyone involved in the delivery chain are likely working at a reduced capacity.

updates.update_userinfo: Delivery Update & Optional Buys Unboxing Pt. 1
updates.update_content:
Starcadians, report in!
We're back with another delivery update and more unboxing photos! Before we get to the juicy bits, let's do a quick recap on the delivery front:
 Australia/New Zealand: Shipping is completed, with a handful of deliveries en route to remaining backers
 Canada: Shipping currently underway

Starcadians, report in!
We're very excited that some backers are already receiving their pledges. For those of you who are still waiting, we'd like to share the Core Box rulebook. This way you'll be ready to play as soon as the pledge gets to your door!
Card Counts and Sizes

Starcadians, report in!
We've got more cool stuff to show you, but first, a delivery update!
Australia - Backers can expect tracking numbers as early as next week as the hub is in its final stages of preparations, with deliveries to begin shortly after.
Rest of the World - The hubs have begun preparations, including the processing of the address changes. Backers should gradually begin to receive tracking numbers in the middle of February.

campaign.story:
Click here to order!
In the shadows of London, terrors stir. Powerful overlords conspire against one another, amassing hordes of monsters to do their bidding. Only one will claim the night and all within it as their prize.
Terrors of London is a competitive deck-builder with a Victorian horror theme. Each player will assume the role of an Overlord, each with a unique ability and two unique influence cards. Throughout the game players will add monsters from four different factions (Beasts, Mortals, Spirits, and Undead) to their deck, all of which can form hordes for powerful combos. Players will also procure marvelous relics, which they may immediately use for their unique abilities. The first player to reduce their opponent's life to zero wins the game and claims the night.
Watch Mark's gameplay video - Click Here!
                                                                                                                                                            Click to Read the Full Preview
                                                                                         Click to read the full preview!
Click to read the full preview!
Click to read the full preview!
                                                                                                         For more detailed information on how to play Terrors of London, please peruse our rules draft here and let us know if you have any questions!
The Victorian Noble pledge includes 4 new Overlords, all of which that use the terror token mechanism. This allows the Overlords to accumulate power for variable effects. It also features more monsters, relics, and starting cards to allow players to play up 2-4 players.
Terrors of London will be available in English, French, and German. You will select the desired language variant after the campaign in the pledge manager. 
All 31 stretch goals have been unlocked creating an expansion called Servants Of The Black Gate that is free to backers at the Victorian Noble level. See all the content unlocked below!
Backers can use the "Manage Pledge" button to add the specified amount from each add-on to their current pledge. Add-ons will be managed through the pledge manager CrowdOx at the end of the campaign. A link will be sent out to all backers who've pledged at least $1. From this link, backers will be able to edit their pledge and choose which add-ons they'd like. Backers can always increase their pledge through CrowdOx to get additional items.
Terrors of London the seventh campaign from Kolossal Games. While Kolossal is new to the industry, we hit the ground running, armed with the knowledge of industry best practices, experienced partners, and wonderful games. We're on track to deliver our first three games (Western Legends, Kami-sama, and Imperius) in record time. This campaign will be no exception. 
Our team is led and supported by industry and marketing experts. We have a machine that works, fueled by amazing games that are designed, developed, and illustrated by incredibly talented people. The game is easy to learn while providing interesting, diverse, and tense game play each game, combining familiar mechanisms in a unique, new way.
The game contains the incredible illustrations and graphic design of the very talented Ryan Pye.
We are committed to begin fulfillment to backers of this game before the it is made available in retail. Components and materials for the game are in the final stages of completion upon launch. All files will be uploaded to our manufacturing partner within one week of the campaign's ending. This ensures timely delivery to our backers.
By backing this game through this campaign, you will receive - at no extra cost Servants Of The Black Gate. We have many exciting and interactive goals planned for those who are backers of Kolossal's seventh official release! 
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories.
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge."
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge. For example, if you pledge $50 to help back the project, we'll offer you a copy of the game along with any stretch goals we achieve as soon as it is manufactured.
You can become a backer in just three easy steps:
Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page.
Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page.
Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing!
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter and share with your friends and family. Also, be sure to like Kolossal Games on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for real-time updates about this project, and find us on Instagram and BoardGameGeek for even more!
Please click on your desired reward level to see the shipping cost for your region. Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, but the reality is that shipping is very expensive and is a cost we all need to share. To offset this, while remaining fiscally responsible, we have included a small discount on ALL shipping, but no shipping is free.
This campaign includes Customs-Friendly delivery to the US, Canada, the UK, and the EU. Customs-Friendly means, if you live in any of these regions and have any additional charges for receiving your package, simply email kickstarter@kolossalgames.com a copy of your customs receipt and we will reimburse you via PayPal. Note: If your country is not in one of the above-mentioned regions, we cannot guarantee customs friendly shipping in these areas. (For example, Norway & Switzerland are not in the European Union.)
Click to Download!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While Terrors of London is our 1st Kickstarter project on Kolossal Mikro, it is the 7th from Kolossal Games, and our team has years of experience with publishing games. We have an impeccable track record of successfully delivering previous Kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters in a timely fashion--if not sooner. Our commitment to building a strong, supportive community around Kolossal Games will enable us to also deliver this project on time and with the highest quality possible. That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. There are many steps in the process of manufacturing and fulfilling a game, many of which involve partnerships. Through careful and thorough planning, common mistakes can be avoided. However, possible delays can occur from circumstances beyond our immediate control. If such an issue is encountered, our team will adapt and no corners will be cut to course correct as needed. Our greatest obstacle is simply the funding capital to manufacture such an ambitious product of the highest quality capable. Your contribution makes this a reality!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
